title: ipi-cfm
description: Data model for IPI CFM Configuration and Operational state

ipi-cfm:cfm.description: Top level container for Ethernet Connectivity Fault Management    Protocol (CFM)

loopback.description: Top level container for Loopback operational data

state.description: Operational data for Loopback

messages-transmitted.description: This attribute specifies the number of messages (LBMs) transmitted for the loopback test

replies-received.description: This attribute specifies the number of replies (LBRs) received for the loopback test

out-of-order-replies-received.description: This attribute specifies the number of out of order replies received by loopback

bad-msdu.description: This attribute specifies the number of bad MAC Service Data Unit(MSDU) received by loopback

linktrace.description: Top level container for Linktrace configuration

cache-enable.description: This attribute specifies the cache enable

cache-size.description: This attribute specifies the cache size

state.description: Operational data for Linktrace

cache-enable.description: This attribute specifies the cache enable

cache-size.description: This attribute specifies the cache size

state.description: Operational data for Linktrace

messages-transmitted.description: This attribute specifies the number of messages (LTMs) transmitted for the linktrace test

replies-transmitted.description: This attribute specifies the number of replies transmitted by linktrace

valid-replies-received.description: This attribute specifies the number of valid replies (LTRs) received for the linktrace test

unexpected-replies-received.description: This attribute specifies the number of unexpected replies received by linktrace

config.description: Configuration data for NVO3 OAM global

mode.description: Use this attribute to set the VxLAN OAM mode of operation

state.description: Operational state data for NVO3 OAM global

mode.description: Use this attribute to set the VxLAN OAM mode of operation

config.description: Configuration data for CFM MEP Continuity Check Message

options.description: This attribute enables debugging for CFM

state.description: Operational data for CFM MEP Continuity Check Message

options.description: This attribute enables debugging for CFM

terminal-debug-status.description: This attribute describes the CFM terminal debug status

maintenance-domains.description: Enclosing container for the list of Maintenence Domains

md-name.description: A unique identifier of a Maintenance Domain
A unique identifier of a Maintenance Domain

type.description: Type discriminator for the value union described in the 'md-name' leaf

level.description: Integer identifying the Maintenance Domain Level (MD Level)

mip-creation.description: This parameter indicates whether the management entity can create MIPs for this MD at this level

maintenance-associations.description: Enclosing container for the list of Maintenence associations

ma-name.description: The value union for the Maintenance Association Name.
The value union for the Maintenance Association Name.

type.description: Name type discriminator for the 'ma-name' leaf

ccm-interval.description: The interval between CCM transmissions to be used by all MEPs in the MA

enable-rmep-auto-discovery.description: This attribute tells whether remote MEPs can be learnt from the peer

static-rmep-identifiers.description: A list of static remote MEPs in a specified MA.

mip-creation.description: This parameter indicates whether the management entity can create MIPs for this MA

vlan-id.description: The VID monitored by this MA

inner-vlan-id.description: The inner VLAN ID monitored by this MA

bridge-id.description: This parameter indicates which bridge this maintenance association will be augumented to.

link-level-ma.description: Use this attribute to set the Service as Link Level MA

mip-interface-name.description: A list of static MIPs configured on the specified interfaces

evpn-id.description: Use this attribute to set the Service as EVPN MA

vpws-vc-name.description: This attribute uniquely identifies a VPWS circuit

mep-id.description: Integer that is unique among all the MEPs in the same MA. Other definition is: a small integer, unique over a given Maintenance Association, identifying a specific Maintenance association End Point

direction.description: A value indicating the direction in which the MEP faces on the interface

administrative-state.description: The administrative state of the MEP

bw-mapped-interface.description: This attribute specifies interface where the bandwidth shapers are to be applied

interface-name.description: An interface, either a Bridge Port or an LAG port within a Bridge Port, to which the MEP is attached

remote-evpn-id.description: Use this attribute to set the Service as EVPN MA

ma-status.description: Status of MA whether it's active or not

continuity-check.description: Enclosing container for the list of CFM MEP Continuity Check Messages

config.description: Configuration data for CFM MEP Continuity Check Message

enable-cc-multicast.description: An indicator of whether the MEP is or is not to generate CCMs

lowest-fault-priority-defect.description: The lowest priority defect that is allowed to generate a Fault Alarm. The non-existence of this leaf means that no defects are to be reported

state.description: Operational data for CFM MEP Continuity Check Message

enable-cc-multicast.description: An indicator of whether the MEP is or is not to generate CCMs

lowest-fault-priority-defect.description: The lowest priority defect that is allowed to generate a Fault Alarm. The non-existence of this leaf means that no defects are to be reported

highest-priority-defect-found.description: Value indicating the highest-priority defect that has been present since the MEP Fault Notification Generator state machine was last in the FNG_RESET state. The non-existence of this leaf represents that no defect has been present since the last FNG_RESET state.

cc-received-defect.description: Defect if received in the last CCM PDU

cc-messages-received.description: The total number of CC messages received

cc-messages-sent.description: The total number of CC messages transmitted

remote-mep-database.description: Enclosing container for the Remote MEP Database

remote-mep.description: List of Remote MEPs learnt or statically configured

rmep-id.description: The MEP ID of a remote MEP

state.description: State data for remote MEPs

rmep-id.description: The MEP ID of a remote MEP

mac-address.description: The MAC address of the remote MEP

rdi.description: An indication of the state of the RDI bit in the last received CCM

evpn-ccms.description: NVO3 OAM EVPN CCMs runtime data

remote-mep-id.description: This attribute represents the CCM remote mep-id

state.description: Operational state data for NVO3 OAM EVPN CCMs

remote-mep-id.description: This attribute represents the CCM remote mep-id

last-good-flow-id.description: This attribute represents the CCM flow-id before flap

last-recovered-flow-id.description: This attribute represents the CCM flow-id after flap

first-good-sequence-number.description: This attribute represents the first good sequence-number of the CCM

last-good-sequence-number.description: This attribute represents the last good sequence-number of the CCM

flow-state.description: This attribute represents the current flow state

last-flapped-time.description: This attribute represents the time of the last down transition

last-recovered-time.description: This attribute represents the time of the last up transition

loopback.description: Top level container for Loopback operational data

last-test-result.description: Container for last Loopback test result

state.description: Operational data for last Loopback test result

target-mac-address.description: This attribute specifies the target MAC address of last loopback test

messages-transmitted.description: This attribute specifies the number of messages transmitted by last loopback test

replies-received.description: This attribute specifies the number of replies received by last loopback test

transaction-id.description: This attribute specifies the transaction-id of a particular linktrace test

state.description: Operational data for Linktrace

transaction-id.description: This attribute specifies the transaction-id of a particular linktrace test

target-mac-address.description: This attribute specifies the target MAC address of a particular linktrace test

index.description: This attribute specifies the index of the reply

state.description: Operational data for Linktrace Reply

index.description: This attribute specifies the transaction-id of a particular reply

hops.description: This attribute specifies the number of hops of a particular reply

destination-mac-address.description: This attribute specifies the destination MAC address of a particular reply

relay-action.description: This attribute specifies the relay action of a particular reply

mep-nvo-operational.description: Container for BaseMode MEP operational data

state.description: Operational state data for BaseMode MEP

direction.description: A value indicating the direction in which the MEP faces on the interface

administrative-state.description: The administrative state of the MEP

remote-vtep-ip.description: This attribute indicates the remote VxLAN Tunnel Endpoint IP address

ethernet-bandwidth-notification.description: Augments to support the ETH-BN functionality

config.description: Configuration data for CFM Y.1731 Ethernet Bandwidth Notification

enable-receive.description: This attribute is used to enable or disable Ethernet Bandwidth Notification (ETH-BN)

wait-to-restore-timer.description: This attribute sets the time to wait before nominal bandwidth is set

peer-port-id.description: This attribute sets the peer port id used to map the received ETH-BN frame

state.description: Operational data for CFM Y.1731 Ethernet Bandwidth Notification

enable-receive.description: This attribute is used to enable or disable Ethernet Bandwidth Notification (ETH-BN)

wait-to-restore-timer.description: This attribute sets the time to wait before nominal bandwidth is set

peer-port-id.description: This attribute sets the peer port id used to map the received ETH-BN frame

nominal-bandwidth.description: This attribute specifies the nominal bandwidth received in the ETH-BN packet

current-bandwidth.description: This attribute specifies the current bandwidth received in the ETH-BN packet

signal-state.description: This attribute specifies whether the signal is normal, pending or degraded

messages-received.description: This attribute contains the count of the total number of ETH-BN messages received

messages-dropped.description: This attribute contains the count of the total number of ETH-BN messages dropped

last-message-received-time.description: This attribute specifies the last ETH-BN message received

message-rx-interval.description: This attribute specifies the message interval received in ETH-BN packet

peer-mac-address.description: This object specifies MAC address of the peer MEP from where ETH-BN frames are received

mep-interface-name.description: This attribute specifies on which interface ETH-BN packets are received

wait-to-restore-time-remaining.description: This attribute specifies the wait-to-restore-time remaining

peer-port-identifier.description: This attribute specifies a unique identifier for the port that is needed in multipoint MEGs if frames with ETH-BN information about different ports would otherwise be identical

curr-state-elapsed-time.description: This attribute specifies the elapsed time in this current signal state

rate-unit.description: Use this attribute to set bandwidth margin rate unit

state.description: Configuration data for bw-margin

rate-unit.description: Use this attribute to set bandwidth margin rate unit

state.description: Configuration data for min-transmit-threshold

ethernet-client-signal-fail.description: Augments to support the CSF functionality

enable-receive.description: This attribute is used to enable or disable Client Signal Fail (CSF)

wait-to-restore-timer.description: This attribute sets the time to wait before nominal bandwidth is set

state.description: State data for CSF

enable-receive.description: This attribute is used to enable or disable Client Signal Fail (CSF)

wait-to-restore-timer.description: This attribute sets the time to wait before nominal bandwidth is set

signal-state.description: This attribute specifies whether the signal is normal, pending or degraded

messages-received.description: This attribute contains the count of the total number of CSF messages received

last-message-received-time.description: This attribute specifies the last CSF message received

message-rx-interval.description: This attribute specifies the received message interval

peer-mac-address.description: This object specifies MAC address of the peer MEP from where CSF frames are received

mep-interface-name.description: This attribute specifies on which interface CSF packets are received

ethernet-locked-signal.description: Augments to support the Locked Signal functionality

config.description: Configuration data for CFM Y.1731 Ethernet Locked Signal

lock-state.description: This attribute specifies the locking state

client-md-level.description: The Maintenance Domain Level of the Client LCK PDU (transmitted level)

interval.description: This attribute specifies the ETH-LCK transmission period

priority.description: This attribute specifies the priority of frames with ETH-LCK information

state.description: Operational data for CFM Y.1731 Ethernet Locked Signal

lock-state.description: This attribute specifies the locking state

client-md-level.description: The Maintenance Domain Level of the Client LCK PDU (transmitted level)

interval.description: This attribute specifies the ETH-LCK transmission period

priority.description: This attribute specifies the priority of frames with ETH-LCK information

receive-status.description: This attribute specifies the current LCK receive status of the MEP

transmit-status.description: This attribute specifies the current LCK transmit status of the MEP

messages-received.description: This attribute contains the count of the total number of LCK messages received

messages-transmitted.description: This attribute contains the count of the total number of LCK messages transmitted

ethernet-alarm-indication-signal.description: Augments to support the ETH-AIS functionality

config.description: Configuration data for CFM Y.1731 Ethernet Alarm Indicaction Signal

enable-status.description: This attribute specifies whether ETH-AIS transmission is enabled

client-md-level.description: The Maintenance Domain Level of the Client ETH-AIS PDU (transmitted level)

interval.description: This attribute specifies the ETH-AIS transmission period

state.description: Operational data for CFM Y.1731 Ethernet Alarm Indicaction Signal

enable-status.description: This attribute specifies whether ETH-AIS transmission is enabled

client-md-level.description: The Maintenance Domain Level of the Client ETH-AIS PDU (transmitted level)

interval.description: This attribute specifies the ETH-AIS transmission period

is-ais-frame-received.description: This attribute specifies whether ETH-AIS is enabled on MEP

y1731-responders.description: Augments to support a node as PM responder

config.description: Configuration data for CFM Y.1731 Ethernet PM responders

enable-lm-responder.description: Enable the MEP to respond for each Loss Measurement Message(LMM)

enable-dm-responder.description: Enable the MEP to respond with Delay Measurement Reply(DMR) for each Delay Measurement Message(DMM) of the peer

state.description: Operational data for CFM Y.1731 Ethernet PM responders

enable-lm-responder.description: Enable the MEP to respond for each Loss Measurement Message(LMM)

enable-dm-responder.description: Enable the MEP to respond with Delay Measurement Reply(DMR) for each Delay Measurement Message(DMM) of the peer

ethernet-test-signal.description: This container contains definitions of ETH-Test Signal state counters

state.description: Operational state data for ethernet test signal counters and    statistics

rmep-id.description: This object specifies MEP ID of the peer MEP for which ETH-Test is intended

peer-mac-address.description: This object specifies MAC address of the peer MEP for which ETH-Test is intended

session-status.description: This object specifies the status of session whether it's in-progress or completed

start-time.description: This object specifies the start time of ETH-Test session

end-time.description: This object specifies the end time of ETH-Test session

elapsed-time.description: This object specifies the length of time that the session ran for, in seconds

in-test-frames.description: This object contains the count of the total number of TST frames received. The count is incremented when a message is received with or without errors.

in-out-of-order-frames.description: This object contains the count of the total number of valid, out-of-order TST frameTST frames received. The count is incremented when the sequence number in the TST frame received does not match the expected sequence number.

in-ber-error-frames.description: This object contains the count of the total number of TST frames received with BER or data errors. The count is incremented when the bit pattern in the received TST frame does not match the expected bit pattern

last-packet-sequence-number.description: This object specifies the sequence number for the last TST packet received

out-test-frames.description: This object contains the count of the total number of TST frames transmitted.

type.description: This object specifies whether the bin number is for Frame Delay, Inter-Frame Delay Variation or Frame Delay Range

bin-number.description: This object specifies the bin number for the configured boundary

threshold.description: This object specifies the lower boundary for a measurement bin. The measurementboundary for each measurement bin is to be larger than the measurement boundary of the preceding measurement bin
